articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: More Americans to be quarantined amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Another group of Americans are heading home from the coronavirus outbreak zone in China. About 250 evacuees will be quarantined for two weeks. Ramy Inocencio has the latest.

articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: China's workers swamp chat and video conference tools
articles.description: Chinese version of WhatsApp crashed after millions of users tried to get work done during the coronavirus lockdown.
articles.content:
The sheer number of people in China forced to work from home to avoid spreading the deadly coronavirus is crashing overburdened messaging and video-conferencing tools. 
With many offices closed, workers and businesses in China are flocking to platforms like … [+2538 chars]

articles.author: jessica learish
articles.title: Deadliest infectious diseases in the world, ranked
articles.description: It's not yet clear how the new coronavirus outbreak will stack up against the world's deadliest infectious diseases.

articles.author: Sophie Lewis
articles.title: Doctor who sounded the alarm on coronavirus dies of illness
articles.description: Dr. Li Wenliang, who was threatened by Chinese officials after warning fellow clinicians of the virus in December, has died of the coronavirus.
articles.content:
A Chinese doctor who was threatened by the government after he voiced concerns about the new coronavirus died from the illness early Friday, officials said. Dr. Li Wenliang died at 2:58 a.m. on February 7, the Wuhan Central Hospital said in a statement.

articles.title: Hong Kong to quarantine visitors from mainland China amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Hong Kong will impose a quarantine on all visitors from mainland China amid the coronavirus outbreak. CBS News Asia correspondent Ramy Inocencio joined CBSN AM from Hong Kong to talk about the latest.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Reporting from inside Wuhan, China – the center of the coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: New York Times China correspondent Amy Qin has been reporting from inside Wuhan, China for almost a week. The city is on lockdown amid the coronavirus outbreak. She joined CBSN AM to talk about her experience.

articles.title: Coronavirus could lead to drop in China's economic growth
articles.description: Analysts believe the coronavirus outbreak could lead to a drop in China's economic growth, which could hurt financial markets around the world. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger joins CBSN AM to talk about the potential impact.

articles.title: More Princess cruise ship passengers have coronavirus
articles.description: Total of 3,700 passengers and crew are expected to be quarantined on the Diamond Princess for two weeks.
articles.content:
Another 10 passengers on a Princess cruise ship in Japan have tested positive for the coronavirus, bringing to 20 the number of people aboard the vessel who have been diagnosed with the illness.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: China cuts tariffs in half on $75 billion of U.S. imports
articles.description: As part of the trade truce, China said it will cut tariffs on U.S. imports including soybeans, pork and auto parts.
articles.content:
China cut tariffs in half on $75 billion of U.S. imports including soybeans, pork and auto parts Thursday in a trade truce with Washington while Beijing struggles with a costly virus outbreak.

articles.title: CDC quarantines 350 Americans over coronavirus

articles.title: Coronavirus deaths mount as U.S. plans more evacuation flights
